page.title: 01 Wootton and Hardingstone
page.content: Hardingstone is about a mile south of Northampton on the edge of higher land which rises from the Nene valley. Wootton is another mile further south. Junction 15 of the M1 is only about two miles away along a dual carriageway and London is about sixty miles away. There is not much employment in the villages which are largely residential and most people work in the Northampton or Milton Keynes areas. Simpson Barracks is between the two villages. The original village centres have been extended from, with a mixture of council and private housing. It is a good place to live because there is a lot of countryside around and the facilities of the town are close at hand.
